required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Neurosensory Alteration After Inferior Alveolar Nerve Lateralization
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Neurosensory Alteration With Computer Guided Inferior Alveolar Nerve Lateralization Versus Non Guided Classic Technique

brief_summary.textblock: : Assessment of the neurosensory alteration with computer guided inferior alveolar nerve lateralization versus non guided classic technique and measuring stability of implant after placement

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: atrophic posterior mandible requiring nerve lateralization

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the neurosensory alteration- sensation over time subjective(a scale 1-10)
primary_outcome.description: assessing the sensation regaining over time subjective (a scale 1-10 )

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the placement and after exposure ( up to 6 months )
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements of the implant stability immediately after placement by osstell

intervention.intervention_name: computer guided IAN lateralization surgical technique
intervention.description: Tthe neurosensory alterations with computer guided inferior alveolar nerve lateralization versus non guided classic technique

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with with atrophied posterior mandibular ridge
- both sexes
- NO intra oral soft and hard tissue pathology
- NO systematic that contraindicate implant placement
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence pathological lesion
- Heavy smokers more than 20 cigarettes per day.
- patients with systemic disease that may affect normal healing
